column2: MARYLAND PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
Question Text
1. Speed limit signs are:
2. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 3. Motorcycles:
column4: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.
column6: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column8: are easier to see than cars.

column2: 4. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column6: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column8: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.

column2: 5. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column6: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.

column2: 6. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column6: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.
column8: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.

column2: 7. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
8. Which sign has white letters on a red background?
9. At a stop sign there is no stop line or crosswalk. You must stop:
column8: after you enter the intersection, if you have a clear view of traffic on the intersecting roadway.

column2: 10. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column4: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column8: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.

column2: 11. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
12. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 13. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 14. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column6: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column8: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

column2: 15. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.
column6: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column8: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.

column2: 16. If you become sleepy while driving you should:
column8: get some rest or change drivers.

column2: 17. BAC is expressed in:
column4: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

23. If you are blinded by headlights on an approaching vehicle, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
column6: move your eyes to the right.

column2: 24. If you see orange construction signs and cones on a freeway, you must:
column4: maintain your current speed while changing lanes.
column6: be prepared for workers and equipment ahead.
column8: make a U-turn because the lane ends ahead.

column2: 25. ___________ are green with white letters and symbols.
